meanings.definition: A person or thing that squirms.
meanings.sent1: The little squirmers in the classroom couldn't sit still during storytime.
meanings.sent2: The baby squirmers giggled and wiggled in their cribs.
meanings.sent3: The squirmers at the party kept dancing around the room.
meanings.sent4: The squirmers in the garden wriggled like tiny snakes.
meanings.sent5: The squirmers on the playground were full of energy and excitement.

meanings.definition: A group of people or things that squirm.
meanings.sent1: The squirmers in the basket were a wriggling mass of worms.
meanings.sent2: The squirmers on the bus made the ride quite lively.
meanings.sent3: The squirmers in the movie theater kept shifting in their seats.
meanings.sent4: The squirmers in the pond resembled a moving carpet of fish.
meanings.sent5: The squirmers in the choir practice couldn't stay still during the performance.
